quotes.text: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Sir, my concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I don't like that man. I must get to know him better.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition. Whether it be true or not, I can say, for one, that I have no other so great as that of being truly esteemed of my fellow-men, by rendering myself worthy of their esteem. How far I shall succeed in gratifying this ambition is yet to be developed.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the courts, not to overthrow the Constitution but to overthrow the men who pervert the Constitution.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: As I would not be a slave, so I would not be a master. This expresses my idea of democracy.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Don't worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: This country, with its institutions, belongs to the people who inhabit it. Whenever they shall grow weary of the existing government, they can exercise their constitutional right of amending it, or exercise their revolutionary right to overthrow it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The shepherd drives the wolf from the sheep's throat, for which the sheep thanks the shepherd as his liberator, while the wolf denounces him for the same act as the destroyer of liberty. Plainly, the sheep and the wolf are not agreed upon a definition of liberty.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I do the very best I know how - the very best I can; and I mean to keep on doing so until the end.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: He has a right to criticize, who has a heart to help.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: No man is good enough to govern another man without the other's consent.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves; and under the rule of a just God, cannot long retain it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The best way to get a bad law repealed is to enforce it strictly.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: At what point then is the approach of danger to be expected? I answer, if it ever reach us, it must spring up amongst us. It cannot come from abroad. If destruction be our lot, we must ourselves be its author and finisher. As a nation of freemen, we must live through all time, or die by suicide.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: All the armies of Europe, Asia and Africa combined, with all the treasure of the earth (our own excepted) in their military chest; with a Buonaparte for a commander, could not by force, take a drink from the Ohio, or make a track on the Blue Ridge, in a trial of a thousand years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Labor is prior to, and independent of, capital. Capital is only the fruit of labor, and could never have existed if labor had not first existed. Labor is the superior of capital, and deserves much the higher consideration.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Marriage is neither heaven nor hell, it is simply purgatory.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I like to see a man proud of the place in which he lives. I like to see a man live so that his place will be proud of him.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: If we could first know where we are, and whither we are tending, we could then better judge what to do, and how to do it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: There is no grievance that is a fit object of redress by mob law.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Towering genius disdains a beaten path. It seeks regions hitherto unexplored.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Don't interfere with anything in the Constitution. That must be maintained, for it is the only safeguard of our liberties.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, so we must think anew and act anew.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The things I want to know are in books; my best friend is the man who'll get me a book I ain't read.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: We should be too big to take offense and too noble to give it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln
